meanings.definition: To make out of date or obsolete.
meanings.sent1: Using old technology quickly outdates your devices.
meanings.sent2: Technology constantly evolves and outdates older models.
meanings.sent3: The ancient computer felt embarrassed when it realized it had outdates itself.
meanings.sent4: The new invention outdates all previous versions in a blink of an eye.
meanings.sent5: The rapid pace of change in technology outdates even the most recent innovations.

meanings.definition: To become out of date or obsolete.
meanings.sent1: If you don't update your software, it quickly outdates.
meanings.sent2: Products that do not adapt to the market trends eventually outdates.
meanings.sent3: The old bookshop sadly watched as its collection slowly outdates.
meanings.sent4: His fashion sense outdates faster than yesterday's news.
meanings.sent5: The once trendy style now outdates as quickly as it emerged.
